ent.origin: Old English findan, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch vinden and German finden.

p.def: A discovery of something valuable, typically something of archaeological interest.
p.eg: He made his most spectacular finds in the Valley of the Kings.

p.def: Discover or perceive by chance or unexpectedly.
p.eg: Lindsey looked up to find Niall watching her.

ent.rhy: affined, behind, bind, blind, hind, humankind, interwind, kind, mankind, mind, nonaligned.
